page.title: 11LITTLE BRYMPTON FARM SHOP
page.content: It began as a small venture growing potatoes in{1976}and has expanded since then to apple tree,raspberries and soft fruit,vegetables and salad crops.We have 3 polythene tunnels and use a lot of perforated mulch.The land was previously used as grazing for horses and before that calf rearing. {Including our own produce}we sell a wide range of imported fruit and vegetables,and try to cater for the up-market customers.Some vegetables are directed especially at the whole sales market eg.Bunched carrots, calabrese,and leeks. The{annual {turnover is about Â£20,000}at present, but still growing. It is a family business employing two or three local part-time workers.The soil is a sandy loam but with clay at the top which is left wild. {(see also p.14)
